results.title: Si J'etais Un Espion... = Breakdown
results.brief_description:
A doctor pays a house call to one of his regular patient suffering from a nervous ailment. He does not find his patient home but encounters a series of strange characters, all very eager to meet the mysterious Mr. Guerin. Before he knows what happens to him, the good doctor his being coerced into finding Guerin for fear of his life.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Bertrand Blier ; writers, Jacques Cousseau, Jean-Pierre Simonot, Philippe Adrien, Bertrand Blier, Antoine Tudal ; photography, Jean-Louis Picavet ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Blier, Bruno Cremer, Patricia Scott, Claude Pieplu, Suzanne Flon.

results.title: Shyness
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: Abnormal shyness in children, its causes and how, through a greater understanding by parents and teachers, this problem may be dealt with. The lonely existence of a typical shy adult is portrayed, and the film then turns to a study of three children: Anna, shy but wistfully wanting association with others; Jimmy, whose excessive timidity is really a symptom of profound emotional disturbance; Robert, aloof but happily independent. Studying their conditions, a psychiatrist from the Child Guidance Clinic reveals the confidence-destroying demands of parents which predisposed the children to shyness. Together, teacher, psychiartrist and parents bring about a change in the children’s attitides. (Awards: Cleveland; New York; Toronto; Boston; Manila.)

results.title: Shutdown
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Don Hopkins, David Springbett and Laura Sky
results.brief_description: Documents the closing-down of an American-owned branch plant with all the personal trauma that such a decision causes to the workers. The employees discuss the dilemma of working in an economy dominated by foreign ownership and the lack of government action to protect jobs in American-owned branch plants.

results.title: Shrivastava and Munni (India )
results.creator_credit: Nihon Hoso Kyokai and Japan Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: With a population of 570 million people India ranks second only to the Republic of China in population; so the work of Munni, a social worker, and Shrivastava, a community leader, takes on new urgency and meaning. The two women journey to out-of-the-way villages to convince largely illiterate village women to use birth control mehtods.

results.title: Shrink proofing wool
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, S.T. Evans, D.G. Corke and P. Bruce
results.brief_description: Describes early attempts to make wool shrink-resistant by chlorination and comments on some adverse effects of this process. It goes on toe cover CSIROs research efforts culminating in a coating technique using a resin polyamide epichlorhydrin. This method is used commercially and renders wool completely shrink proof. Reference is made to the parallel development of a method of continuous dyeing of wool and that these developments are compatible.

results.title: Shringar: hair styles of India
results.creator_credit: Films Division, Government of India, Ezra Mir and Ravi Prakash
results.brief_description: Indian women’s hair styles; their origin in tradition; how the hair is dressed and how the styles may be adapted to wear with Western dress. A stylist makes sketches for hair styles based on those seen in temple carvings and the Ajunta cave frescoes; how the hair is oiled and the styles built up; the use of garlands, particularly jasmine, and jkewellery; dressing a Western woman’s hair in adaptations of Indian styles.

results.title: Shrine
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Film Productions, John Dixon, Film Victoria, Kent Chadwick and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: The Shrine of Remembrance in Melbourne was built as a memorial to Victorians who served in the first World War, and also honours those who served in the Second World War. The film looks at the Shrine, and the feelings of pride and mateship amongst Australian soldiers who fought in both wars.

results.title: Shrek storyboard pitch
results.brief_description: Lord Farquaad ruthlessly (and hilariously) interrogates Gingerbread Man in one of the most memorable scenes in Shrek (2001), but before the bit appeared in the movie, storyboard artist Conrad Vernon performed it as a ‘pitch’ to the filmmaking team.
results.description:
Lord Farquaad ruthlessly (and hilariously) interrogates Gingerbread Man in one of the most memorable scenes in Shrek (2001), but before the bit appeared in the movie, storyboard artist Conrad Vernon performed it as a ‘pitch’ to the filmmaking team.

Animated films aren’t always scripted from start to finish, so teams of artists collaborate on developing scenes and stories they then perform to show how the rhythm and visuals will fit in the completed film.

Because of the close relationship between story, pacing and drawing, storyboard artists need to be performers and storytellers as well as visual artists. Vernon was definitely a triple threat, and his performance as Gingy in the pitch was so impressive that he voiced the fan-favourite character in the movie.
